name: Bone Golem
description: The Bone Golem is a medium-sized construct composed entirely of bones, resembling a pile of ordinary skeletons when motionless. It has a strong frame, showcasing its resilience on the battlefield.
memorable: Its ability to absorb necrotic damage and potentially go berserk when injured creates a compelling and dangerous combat encounter.
goals: Typically programmed by a creator to guard or protect an area or carry out specific tasks.
relations: Often created and controlled by necromancers or powerful beings skilled in crafting constructs.
environment: Commonly found in dark places such as dungeons, necromancer lairs, or graveyards.
strengths: Immunities to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage, along with resistance to nonmagical attacks, make it exceptionally tough in combat.
weaknesses: Very low intelligence and charisma limit its usefulness outside of combat scenarios.
attacks: The Bone Golem can perform multiple melee claw attacks and ranged bone shard attacks, dealing both slashing and necrotic damage.
most_powerful_ability: Necrotic Absorption allows it to heal from necrotic damage instead of taking it.
additional_information: Immutable Form grants immunity to any effects that would alter its form.
Magic Resistance provides an advantage on saving throws against spells.
Berserk state triggers when its HP drops below 30, causing it to attack uncontrollably.
False Appearance makes it difficult to distinguish from ordinary bones when stationary.
Its creator can attempt to calm it during a berserk state with a successful Persuasion check.
